perturbation.original_text:
11.6 Governing Law. This Agreement, the rights and obligations of the parties hereto, and any claims
or disputes thereto, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York
without reference to conflict of law principles. Venue for any proceedings not subject to arbitration under this
Agreement shall be in the state and federal courts located in New York, New York.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.11 Independent Contractors. Notwithstanding any provision hereof, for purposes of this Agreement,
each party shall be and act as an independent contractor and not as a partner, a joint venturer, or an agent of
the other party, and shall not bind nor attempt to bind the other party in any way without prior written consent.
11.6 Governing Law. This Agreement, the rights and obligations of the parties hereto, and any claims
or disputes thereto, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware
without reference to conflict of law principles. Venue for any proceedings not subject to arbitration under this
Agreement shall be in the state and federal courts located in Atlanta, Georgia.
11.12 Survival. Sections 1, 2, 3, 4, 6.1(ii), 6.3, 6.4, 6.5, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 11 shall survive the expiration or
termination of this Agreement for any reason.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the governing law and venue to Delaware and Atlanta, Georgia introduces potential enforceability issues, especially since one of the companies is based in Chicago, Illinois, which is not in alignment with the main place of business. This contradiction regarding jurisdiction introduces uncertainty, which introduces enforceability issues.

perturbation.original_text:
11.7 Arbitration. If any dispute arises under this Agreement that is not settled promptly in the ordinary
course of business, the Parties shall seek to resolve any such dispute between them; first, by negotiating
promptly with each other in face-to-face negotiations. Any controversy or claim arising out of or relating to the
interpretation, enforcement or breach of this Agreement that cannot be resolved within fifteen (15) business
days (or such period as the Parties shall otherwise agree) through face-to-face negotiations shall be resolved
by binding arbitration in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration
Association. Arbitration shall be by a single arbitrator mutually acceptable to the parties and experienced in
the matters at issue and selected by the Parties in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the
American Arbitration Association. If the parties are unable to agree upon a single arbitrator, each party shall
select an arbitrator and the two arbitrators shall select the third arbitrator. The arbitration shall only be held in
New York, New York. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding and may be enforced in any court
having jurisdiction over the subject matter or either of the Parties, except that each party reserves all rights of
appeal. The arbitrator(s) shall determine to what extent each of the Parties shall bear the costs and expenses
incurred in connection with any such arbitration proceeding (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and
expenses) on the basis of the arbitrator’s assessment of the relative merits of the Parties’ positions.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.7 Arbitration. If any dispute arises under this Agreement that is not settled promptly in the ordinary
course of business, the Parties may seek to resolve any such dispute between them; first, by negotiating
promptly with each other in face-to-face negotiations. Any controversy or claim arising out of or relating to the
interpretation, enforcement or breach of this Agreement that cannot be resolved within fifteen (15) business
days (or such period as the Parties shall otherwise agree) through face-to-face negotiations shall be resolved
by non-binding mediation. Mediation shall be by a mediator not subject to any rules and unlicensed in the matters at issue and selected by either party. If the parties are unable to agree upon a single mediator, each party shall send a list of possible mediators. The mediation shall be held in either New York, New York or Atlanta, Georgia. The decision of the mediator shall be non-binding and may be used in a court
having jurisdiction over the subject matter or either of the Parties, each party  waives all rights of
appeal. The mediator shall determine to what extent each of the Parties shall bear the costs and expenses
incurred in connection with any such mediation proceeding (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and
expenses).
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'binding arbitration' to 'non-binding mediation' and removing the American Arbitration Association rules, it weakens the enforceability of dispute resolution. The original text also stated each party reserves all rights of appeal, but now with a mediator, each party waives all rights of appeal.

perturbation.original_text:
7.5 Required Disclosures. Notwithstanding the foregoing, World Book acknowledges that HSWI is a
publicly listed company subject to various disclosure regulations. In connection with such, World Book
acknowledges that HSWI may disclose in its regulatory filings, investor communications, and associated
statements the World Book Brand and those aspects of this Agreement that HSWI reasonably finds are
required to be disclosed by law or regulation. HSWI will use its commercially reasonable efforts to consult with
World Book on any such legally required public disclosures of the World Book Brand and this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.3 Taxes. To the extent required, HSWI shall pay all sales, use or similar state or local taxes in
connection with this Agreement, except for employment taxes or taxes related to World Book’s income.
7.5 Required Disclosures. Notwithstanding the foregoing, World Book acknowledges that HSWI may disclose in its regulatory filings the World Book Brand and those aspects of this Agreement that HSWI reasonably finds are required to be disclosed. HSWI is not required to consult with World Book on legally required public disclosures of the World Book Brand and this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'HSWI will use its commercially reasonable efforts to consult with World Book' to 'HSWI is not required to consult with World Book', World Book has no way to confirm if the disclosures are accurate. HSWI's ability to disclose the contents of the agreement without proper oversight diminishes World Book's control over how its brand and confidential information are presented to the public, potentially harming its reputation or competitive position. This could be seen as a breach of good faith and fair dealing, as it allows one party to unilaterally control public messaging related to the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934; Good Faith and Fair Dealing
